the wide use of the dollar globally can also pose Financial stability challenges that can materially affect households businesses and markets for that reason the FED has played a key role in promoting Financial stability and supporting the use of dollars internationally through our liquidity facilities the Central Bank liquidity swap lines provide foreign central banks with the capacity to deliver US dollar funding to institutions in their jurisdictions

and the foreign and international monetary authorities or FEMA repo facility allows approved account holders the option to temporarily exchange their US Treasury Securities held by the FED for US dollars

these facilities serve as liquidity backstop so that holders of dollar assets and participants in dollar funding markets can be confident that strains will be eased when these markets come under stress
that insurance intern mitigates the effect of such strains on the flow of credit to us households and businesses
